alert.note: Alert for Kaufman (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 28 at 11:57AM CDT until October 29 at 1:12PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Ellis and Kaufman. * WHEN...Until 100 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is ongoing or imminent. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through urban drainage systems. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Flooding is ongoing in the warned area due to heavy rainfall that fell during the overnight and into this morning. Between 6 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waxahachie, Ennis, Terrell, Red Oak, Kaufman, Palmer, Bardwell, Grays Prairie, Alma, Cottonwood, Bardwell Lake, Garrett, Scurry, Bristol, Pecan Hill, Oak Grove, Post Oak Bend City, Rosser, Oak Ridge and Crisp.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
